node.excerpt: "Where do you see yourself in ten years?" is the kind of question that gives me serious goosebumps. I hate to be reminded that everything will keep changing, and they will in the months to come. However, the past is also tough to face if you're not‚Ä¶

frontmatter.title: We Don't Talk About Future
frontmatter.description: The only safe bet is someday I'm gonna be gone.

node.excerpt: Convincing yourself that some things wouldn't work out is hard. I wrote this one in an attempt to believe it, hiding the predictable title choice behind an acronym. YDWML! Feeling too much and too fast  It‚Äôs not healthy for me  Not healthy for you if‚Ä¶

frontmatter.title: YDWML!
frontmatter.description: Not healthy for me, not healthy for you if you knew.

node.excerpt: I've tried many approaches when it comes to writing, but one method that I love is coming up with a title first. And titles come out of nowhere. For instance, I held onto the idea of a two-part song with similar messages, but different approaches‚Ä¶

frontmatter.title: In Case You Ever Listen
frontmatter.description: My mind goes as far as that and it doesn't get back as soon as you do.
